summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message from Pastor Travis Hearn about taking back what the enemy has stolen! PT delivered an incredible sermon declaring 2024 as the 'year of the takeback' - a rallying cry for believers to reclaim everything the devil has tried to steal. Drawing from personal experiences of theft and violation, Pastor Travis passionately reminded us that Satan's ultimate goal isn't just to steal our possessions, but our peace, joy, identity, and ultimately our soul. Can you imagine standing up and declaring, 'It's mine, and I'm coming to take it back'? That's exactly what PT challenged Impact Church to do! He outlined four powerful strategies: never stop believing, never stop praying, never unplug from the body of Christ, and never stop praising. The most incredible moment? When he proclaimed that praise is a weapon that confuses the enemy - that when you praise God in the midst of your darkest moments, you're actually fighting back! Pastor Travis shared how God tricked him into connection through community service hours after a DUI, showing how God can use unexpected situations to transform our lives. This sermon isn't just a message; it's a battle cry for believers to rise up and reclaim everything the enemy has tried to steal.
mainPoints: Declare 2024 as the year of taking back what the enemy has stolen
Use prayer, belief, community, and praise as weapons against the enemy
Stay connected to God and His people to maintain spiritual strength

versesMentioned.text: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full.

But David said to Saul, 'Your servant has been keeping his father's sheep. When a lion or a bear came and carried off a sheep from the flock, I went after it, struck it and rescued the sheep from its mouth. When it turned on me, I seized it by its hair, struck it and killed it.'
Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.
May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in him, so that you may overflow with hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
Not giving up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but encouraging one another—and all the more as you see the Day approaching.
Through Jesus, therefore, let us continually offer to God a sacrifice of praise—the fruit of lips that openly profess his name.
And the God of all grace, who called you to his eternal glory in Christ, after you have suffered a little while, will himself restore you and make you strong, firm and steadfast.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 34:1: 'I will extol the Lord at all times; his praise will always be on my lips.'
Monday.action: Make a list of three things the enemy has tried to steal from you. Next to each, write a declaration of faith about how God will restore it.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see my challenges through Your lens of victory. Give me the strength to praise You even in difficult circumstances. Reveal to me the areas where I've allowed the enemy to steal my joy and peace. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 10:4: 'The weapons we fight with are not the weapons of the world. On the contrary, they have divine power to demolish strongholds.'
Tuesday.action: Identify one area of your life where you feel defeated. Spend time in prayer, declaring God's promises over that situation.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, show me the spiritual battles I'm facing. Give me wisdom to fight not with my own strength, but with Your power. Help me recognize the enemy's tactics and stand firm in Your truth. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Ephesians 6:12: 'For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.'
Wednesday.focus: Recognizing the true nature of our battles
Wednesday.action: Journal about a current challenge. Pray over it, asking God to reveal the spiritual dynamics at play and how He wants you to respond.
Wednesday.prayer: God, open my spiritual eyes. Help me see beyond the surface of my challenges and understand the deeper spiritual realities. Guide me in fighting with prayer and praise, not with my own understanding. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: James 4:7: 'Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.'
Thursday.action: Create a personal 'praise playlist' of worship songs that remind you of God's faithfulness. Listen to it when you feel discouraged.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, teach me to resist the enemy through worship and praise. Help me submit fully to You and stand firm in Your promises. Give me courage to praise You in every circumstance. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Isaiah 54:17: ''No weapon forged against you will prevail, and you will refute every tongue that accuses you. This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord, and this is their vindication from me,' declares the Lord.'
Friday.action: Write down three promises of God that you can declare over your life. Speak these out loud throughout the day.
Friday.prayer: Faithful God, remind me of my inheritance as Your child. Help me walk in the authority and power You've given me. Strengthen my faith to believe Your promises are true, no matter what circumstances say. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: 1 John 4:4: 'You, dear children, are from God and have overcome them, because the one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.'
Saturday.action: Reflect on the week. Where did you see God's hand moving? Write a letter of thanksgiving to God, celebrating His faithfulness.
Saturday.prayer: Loving Father, thank You for Your constant presence and protection. Help me live from a place of victory, not fear. Remind me that You are always greater than any challenge I face. Strengthen my faith and help me to continually praise You. Amen.
